I also like the "cheapest day of the week" and "lowest base fee" things (though I think 54 being the 30 day low is incorrect as I'm pretty sure I have got things included below 54 in the last month).

author: sky.cactus
content: Maybe have 3 base fee charts (1 hour, 24 hour, 7 days) and draw a lowest, 5th percentile, and 50th percentile line on it or something.  Chart coloring based on *when* it was below each line would be an added bonus.  Then you could easily see what some good historic prices are based on your willingness to wait.

author: potuz
content: <@636289909359116290>  the issue with naming is interesting. I don't use wallets much and don't interact with apps much either, but the little I do shows that there's no standard naming at least post London. My intuition would be to give averages or last values for the baseFeePerGas and priorityFee. And then recommend the maxFeePerGas and priorityFee accordingl, but naming them so. I find it weird that I have to guess what each field in metamask or whatever site I'm seeing means. Typically the meaning is clear, but the fact that they chose a different name makes me look in their documentation just to make sure, that doesn't make any sense

author: chris2_2_2
content: Yep!

author: chris2_2_2
content: Definitely needs to be better documentation and standardization
